critique: The document expresses concern about the teaching of American history and establishes a commission to promote patriotic education. It conveys a sense of urgency and determination to correct what it perceives as a distorted view of the nation's founding. The document aims to inspire pride and unity, while also addressing concerns about division and self-doubt. The document expresses sadness and disgust at the current state of affairs, joy at the prospect of a renewed and confident national unity, and surprise at the recent attacks on the founding.
